description: two women seated at a table outdoors with a standing man with a moustache, holding a bottle, at right; woman in foreground holds a glass for the baby on her lap to drink; other figures in middle ground and background, including a girl wearing a checked blouse leaning over the back of a bench, seen from back; printed in salmon pink and green
inscription:
Signature, Title, Inscription, and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [951527] and [lo33]
markings: LRC, impressed in paper: [ED SAGOT / Editeur / PARIS]
provenance: [Eric G. Carlson Fine Prints and Drawings, New York, until 2000; sold in August for SSO, to Drake]; Harry Drake, St. Paul (2000-d. 2012; bequeathed to MIA)
signed: LRC, in pencil: [A Lepere]; on back, in pencil: [Dimanche à la Guinguette]
title: Sunday at a Tavern
